summary: The Specialty Physicians Advancing Rural Care Act (SPARC Act) aims to address the shortage of specialty medicine physicians and non-physician specialty health care providers in rural communities. It amends the Public Health Service Act to establish a loan repayment program for these healthcare professionals. Eligible participants would receive loan repayment assistance in exchange for a six-year commitment to practice in underserved rural areas. The bill also includes provisions regarding eligible loans, breach of contract, reporting to Congress, definitions, and authorization of appropriations.
